awd_titl_txt: Glacial Geology of the Icefields of the East Antarctic Ice  Sheet near the Allan Hills, Victoria Land
awd_abstract_narration: This investigation is designed to test important hypotheses                     regarding the East Antarctic ice sheet and the bedrock geology at               its base:                                                                                                                                                       1)  Clay samples from supraglacial moraines (Elephant and                           Reckling Moraines) will be analyzed for microfossils (marine                    diatoms) in order to confirm the existence of a marine                          embayment on the continent in Neogene time and to determine                     the source of detrital feldspar grains by Rb-Sr dating;                                                                                                     2)  Geochemical and isotopic data will be used to determine                         whether specimens of black acicular calcite from the Elephant                   Moraine are of hydrothermal origin and therefore indicate the                   former presence of hot springs under the East Antarctic ice                     sheet; and                                                                                                                                                  3)  The oxygen and hydrogen isotope composition of 135 ice                          samples collected along surveyed traverses are expected to                      indicate whether the icefields adjacent to the supraglacial                     moraines expose a stratigraphic cross-section of the East                       Antarctic ice sheet.                                                            ***  //
